primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes a new creation (New Jerusalem) to restore humanity to a state of perfect love and beauty through the substitutionary sacrifice of the Lamb.

tekstueel_bewijs: He will wipe every tear from their eyes.
God himself will be with them.

object.identificatie: The New Creation / Restoration of Humanity
tekstueel_bewijs: a new heaven and a new earth
the Holy City, the new Jerusalem
I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End.
To the thirsty I will give water without cost
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver (the thirsty one) rather than the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: Behold the Lamb of God who taketh away the sin of the world
he clothes you in his righteousness
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (Initiator) and Helper (Mediator via the Lamb).
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the internal agent of beauty (indwelling power).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Old Order
tekstueel_bewijs: There will be no more death or mourning
No longer will there be any curse
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the 'curse' and 'death' itself, requiring a divine Subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having received the hope, serves the earthly city as a reflection of the heavenly one.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical program is a response to the soteriological gift; one serves the city because the New Jerusalem is coming.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God himself will be with them.
Jesus Christ loves you not because you are lovely but in order to make you lovely.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You have to give them hope.
We have to make fig leaves.
You can make it your own if you notice three kinds of languages.

voorbeelden: You as a Christian will go out there and you will have the impetus... to do what small things you can.
I have no idea why you wouldn’t want it to be true.
Let’s learn the hope they needed.
This will enable you to face it.
The Holy Spirit starts to actually make us beautiful.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) granted by God to endure suffering, rather than the 'Obligation' (Devoir) to perform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the 'Old Order' (S2) through the failure of 'Secular Hopes' (~S1) to the 'Already but Not Yet' of Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the Lamb taking the Curse (S2) to provide the Gift (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and the 'sword of judgment' are presented as real cosmic threats.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently makes God the Subject of the primary narrative. Human action is framed as a 'thirsty' reception of a 'free gift'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You can make it your own if you notice three kinds of languages.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ loves you not because you are lovely but in order to make you lovely.
Who gets into the city? The thirsty... those who know they need to be saved by grace.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; the 'original readers' are used to illustrate the human condition of suffering, not as models of virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric focus on God's action in history.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment (hope) rather than guilt or burden.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic restoration; God provides the beauty he requires.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (salvation) to the secondary program (service) is clearly sequential and grounded in the primary.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'already' and 'not yet' is maintained without collapsing into moralism.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s Son is going to die in our place on the cross so that our firstborn don’t have to die.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) to become beautiful and endure.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'curse' and 'sin' that requires the death of the Lamb.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented actantial structure where God is the Subject and the human is the Receiver.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The current balance serves the purpose of providing hope in suffering.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon masterfully avoids the 'Exemplarism Trap' by focusing on the Lamb as the active agent of change.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'City/Bride' metaphors, Greimas reveals that the 'City' is the Object of God's action, not a human achievement.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the text; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' functions to give the hearer a specific role (Receiver).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'beauty' of the bride is a modal competence (Pouvoir) given by the Subject (God), not a Devoir (duty) of the bride.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'already/not yet' framework to prevent the secondary program (ethics) from collapsing into the primary program (salvation).
